s.text: USAT implies the "Hollywood" tag was meant to refer to Monica Lewinsky's Los Angeles-based lawyer, William Ginsburg.

The judge in the Espy aide case ignored the sentencing guideline recommendation of probation to hand down a 27-month sentence for lying, and while doing so, referred darkly to a "Hollywood" lawyer and others who have suggested that lying under oath in a civil case isn't a big deal.

The judge in the Espy aide case ignored the sentencing guideline recommendation of probation to hand down a 27-month sentence for lying, and while doing so, referred darkly to a "Hollywood" lawyer and others who have suggested that lying under oath in a civil case isn't a big deal.
The paper concludes the judge wanted to "send a message to key players in the White House intern scandal."
The paper concludes the judge wanted to "send a message to key players in the White House intern scandal."
The metro edition of the Times leads with the unanimous decision by the New York City Board of Education to require elementary school kids to wear uniforms.
